sentences.en: A thief can break into a car in under ten seconds.
sentences.cn: 窃贼十秒钟之内就能把车撬开.

sentences.en: He made an unsuccessful attempt to stop the thief.
sentences.cn: 他试图捉住小偷,但未能成功.

sentences.en: He was a skiver, and a thief.
sentences.cn: 他是个逃学精，还偷东西。

sentences.en: Ness chased the thief down and held him until police arrived.
sentences.cn: 内斯追上小偷，按住他，一直等到警察赶到。

sentences.en: The boss alerted him that thief might come out at night.
sentences.cn: 老板要他提防夜里可能有贼.

sentences.en: The policeman decided to play cat - and - mouse game with the thief.
sentences.cn: 警察决定对那个小偷采取欲擒故纵的办法.

sentences.en: The thief broke the window and got into the house.
sentences.cn: 那个窃贼打破窗子,进入屋内.

sentences.en: The thief got clean away with the money.
sentences.cn: 那个贼拿着钱逃之夭夭了。

sentences.en: The thief had broken in through a first-floor window.
sentences.cn: 小偷是从二楼的窗户进入屋里的。

sentences.en: The thief managed to throw his pursuers off the scent.
sentences.cn: 小偷终于把追踪者甩掉了.

sentences.en: The thief was pushed and pummeled by an angry crowd.
sentences.cn: 一群人推搡并痛打小偷.

sentences.en: The thief was put on probation for two years.
sentences.cn: 这个小偷被处以两年缓刑。

sentences.en: The thief was trapped by the police in an old house.
sentences.cn: 小偷被警察困在一所旧房子里.

sentences.en: They were nothing but petty thieves (= thieves who steal small things ) .
Thieves broke into the offices and stole $150,000’s worth of computer equipment.
sentences.cn: 小偷破门进入办公室，偷走了价值15万美元的电脑设备。

sentences.en: You are protected instantly if a thief misuses your credit card.
sentences.cn: 如果小偷盗用你的信用卡，你的卡会立即受到保护。

trans.tran_cn: 小偷，盗贼，<口>（使蜡外流的）蜡烛心结的烛花
trans.tran_en: someone who steals things from another person or place
